title: Long Division
text: Write it as a long division problem. \\n Be sure the dividend is in standard form.

title: Long Division
text: Divide $$x^2$$ by x. It may help to ask yourself, “What do I need \\n to multiply x by to get x**2?”

title: Long Division
text: Put the answer, x, in the quotient over the x term. \\n Multiply x times $$x+5$$. Line up the like terms under the dividend.

title: Long Division
text: Subtract $$x^2+5x$$ from $$x^2+9x$$. \\n You may find it easier to change the signs and then add. \\n Then bring down the last term, 20.

title: Long Division
text: Divide 4x by x. It may help to ask yourself, “What do I \\n need to multiply x by to get 4x ?” \\n Put the answer, 4 , in the quotient over the constant term.

title: Long Division
text: Subtract $$4x+20$$ from $$4x+20$$. We get 0 so there is no remainder.
